attributes.action: Bring back National Service.
attributes.background: Nowadays, there are many ill-behaved young adults in the communities across the UK. National Service will not only correct the behavioural errors they make, but give them good incentive to do something good in their lives whilst in this military programme and get experience on military life.

attributes.action: Don't put down Army dogs because they can't be re-homed. We owe a duty of care
attributes.background:
Two hero Army dogs which helped save thousands of lives on duty in Afghanistan are to be put down because they can't be re-homed, it has been reported.
Ex soldiers and dog handlers who worked with the Belgian Shepherds are said to have written to a Defence chief demanding the decision be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
â€œThis is such a cruel way to treat these animals that have given us so much.
â€œPeople who worked closely with these dogs are devastated at the plans â€” theyâ€™ve begged to save them all.
"Experienced handlers have come forward to say they want to house the much-loved dogs, who have helped save hundreds of lives. 
In 2012, The Mirror reported how 807 of our much-loved military dogs had been destroyed by the Army over the past decade despite years of faithful service.
Daily Mirror online 1/12.17

attributes.action: Ensure HMI inspectors inspecting SEN schools have sufficient experience in SEN
attributes.background: From both personal experience and talks with others educational professionals, the majority of OFSTED inspectors who grade special schools have insufficient knowledge of SEN or more shockingly, none.

attributes.action: Ban Hate Groups, Britain First & English Defence League!
attributes.background: Under the Terrorism Act 2000, the Home Secretary may proscribe(ban) an organisation if (s)he believes it is concerned in terrorism, and it is proportionate to do. We call upon the Home Secretary to add Britain First and the EDL to the list of proscribed organisations.
attributes.additional_details:
This same terrorism act declares "acts of terrorism" as "acts of persons acting on behalf of, or in connection with, any organisation which carries out activities directed towards the overthrowing or influencing, by force or violence, of Her Majesty's government in the United Kingdom or any other government de jure or de facto."
We believe Britain First are advocates of racially motivated violence and this is well documented with violence at rallies and unfettered hate speech.
Britain does not tolerate this when it is religiously motivated, why should we tolerate it when it is founded on 'Nationalism'.

attributes.action: Put additional stamp duty on international buyers
attributes.background: Foreign buyers have driven the demands of our properties. This is making properties prices higher and higher. This needs to be controlled. A lots of properties that foreign buyers own remain empty as well.

attributes.action: Make sure that development of new drugs is not adversely affected by BREXIT.
attributes.background: The Government must commit to following the current process for all drugs already in the EU clinical trial and approval pipeline.
attributes.additional_details:
Doctors and drug companies work in many countries to develop a drug.  Drugs in development now will be in Clinical Trial both before and after March 2019.

Bodies like the European Medicines Agency regulate drug approval with a single set of regulations and approval steps. 

Developing effective treatments for debilitating diseases will greatly reduce the long-term financial and social cost to the UK.

https://www.ft.com/content/e3e9ac6a-5f2d-11e7-8814-0ac7eb84e5f1

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Make rail strikes illegal
attributes.background: Rail strikes cause misery to millions of commuters and also have a negative impact on the economy. Taxpayers subsidise train delays too. Make train strikes illegal. Railway employees should be open to the modernisation of the railways which ultimately benefits all.

attributes.action: Allow under 40s to access their pension pot in order to buy their first house.
attributes.background: Young people are struggling to raise the funds to but their first home, yet they can have enough money for a deposit in their pension funds. The simplest solution being that younger people should be able to access their pension funds purely for use as a deposit for their first home.

attributes.action: Remove stamp duty for First Time Buyers by making sellers pay the tax
attributes.background:
Stamp Duty is a prohibitive tax to home ownership. 
First time buyers need help and will struggle to find the deposit as the UK is suffering a massive shortfall in homes. 
Most sellers have large  equity gains & removing the need for them to pay on their purchase, will allow the cost to be offset
attributes.additional_details:
By allowing this change, the whole market will benefit from movement as chains are completed by those hitherto unable to make the duty plus deposit.

Those downsizing and coming out of the market would have to pay more but they sit on the largest profits anyway  

First-time buyers in the UK could save an average of Â£3,625, while Londoners could save Â£13,171, if the tax burden was shifted to sellers.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-39139128

attributes.action: Prevent purchasers withdrawing from domestic property sales without consequence.
attributes.background: In England purchasers having had an offer accepted by the vendor are at liberty to withdraw from the transaction right up until contracts are exchanged without any cause. When this happens the vendors are usually unable to complete their purchase and left with significant nugatory costs to bear.

attributes.action: To make it easier for grandparents to get parental Responsibility
attributes.background: Fathers, same sex parents and step parents can get PR by downloading the form and taking it to the local court to be witnessed and signed and thatâ€™s it they have PR.
attributes.additional_details: Grandparents have to get mediation and then apply to the family court for permission to apply for a residence order or special guardianship order which can all take months. How can this be right over 200,000 grandparents are bringing up one of more of their grandchildren. I realise children have to be protected and made safe but making it this hard for grandparents to get PR is not doing this.

attributes.action: Set up an online registry for living organ donation
attributes.background: I recently called my regional transplant centre to donate a kidney and found that the process of ringing and finding information about living donation daunting and difficult. An online living donor registry with a pre-screening process could help encourage others to come forward and also save time.
attributes.additional_details:
I was told that it was unlikely to be able to due to being a young female (risks of renal failure during future pregnancy). A online registry with sufficient information could therefore save time as the medical professional had to explain the reasoning to me whilst simultaneously ensuring only those eligible come forward. 
From my perspective, there isn't enough education and awareness surrounding this topic and promoting living donation more may significantly help the many people in need

attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: Protect more of our countryside and seas by creating more conservation zones.
attributes.background: Disappearing habitat,destructive means of fishing by trawling, aquaculture in estuaries, pesticides in farming all harming our environment.

attributes.action: No more speed humps and better sequencing of traffic lights for cleaner air
attributes.background:
Traffic calming measures might be reducing the chance of an accident, but they increase pollution
Cars repeatedly slowing down and speeding up, which almost doubles the amount of harmful gases and particles they emit. Not to mention break dust
Green wave for drivers driving within the speed limit
attributes.additional_details:
It should be a better way to keep the traffic slow and steady.
Cameras could be installed in 20mph zones to keep the cars slow and steady.
It should be speed cameras in front of every school and pedestrian crossing as well.
Traffic lights should be better sequenced as well (green wave) to protect that drivers will keep arriving at green lights rather than red ones if they drive within the speed limit

attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: Driving licence: Introduce mandatory re-training/re-examination every 5-10y
attributes.background: Driving tech, laws, training & examination changes/improves, as such, we should introduce mandatory re-skilling/examination to ensure all drivers are up to par also allowing removal of drivers from the road whom would not meet modern driving skill/knowlege requirements to make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: We live in an age where someone could have passed their test 50 years ago, and not have any of the modern driving skills or knowledge that is imparted onto modern drivers, all drivers should have to be kept "up to skill" to ensure they are safe road users.

attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Introduce a tourist tax in London - similar to the likes of New York and Naples.
attributes.background: Introducing a tourist tax would increase funds available in the capital for a whole range of issues - from tackling homelessness to improving existing infrastructure.

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Have a meaningful vote on Parliamentary Petitions after a debate
attributes.background: Currently petitions from this website have no legislative effect, they are merely debated and then left in the dust. To be a more transparent democracy this should be changed such that these public parliamentary petitions may be formed into motions and potentially into law.
attributes.additional_details:
In my eyes an ideal system would be to have these petitions firstly carry on as they are; proceeding to go to debate if they hit 100,000 signatories, have the non-binding debate in parliament as is at the moment and THEN, after that debate, have all present Commons MPs vote on forming the petition into an official parliamentary motion that is then brought to the Commons Chamber.

This will create for a more direct and transparent democracy which I would hope for the government to support.

attributes.action: Illegal dog fighting - raise the period of imprisonment.
attributes.background: Although illegal, dog fighting and baiting; using dogs and cats is still going on.The maximum sentence for offenders is six months in prison and/or an unlimited fine, but campaigners want it to be raised to up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details: Â The Animal Welfare Act 2006  has introduced an important and new concept for pet owners and those responsible for domestic animals. Dog fighting is still going on and proactive action needs to be taken to prevent such crimes, not just reactive action often when animals have been so cruelly killed.

attributes.action: CARIBBEAN DAY is recognized as AUGUST 1st
attributes.background: The UK Caribbean community in several areas including politics, entertainment and sports is an integral part of a socially integrated modern Britain.  This petition seeks that Parliament pronounce  recognition that AUGUST 1st is a date of culture significance for the UK Caribbean community.
attributes.additional_details: The Caribbean and its descendents have been part of Britainâ€™s fortune for centuries. The wealth generated from the colonies provided national means prior to the Industrial Revolution; In the First World War the West Indies Regiment comprised of Caribbean volunteers joined with Britain in time of war and the Caribbean community was present again for WW2, and after Caribbean immigrants answered the call to rebuild Britainâ€™s labour, health and transportation services economy.  A day of remembrance.

attributes.action: Ban anti bird spikes from being installed on trees and other natural roosts.
attributes.background:
Residents in a wealthy area of Bristol have installed the spikes on the roosting branches of some trees to protect their cars from bird poo.
UK Bird populations are in great decline. Heinous practices like this is wrong on so many levels.
attributes.additional_details:
It was with great outrage and disgust that I saw this post on Twitter and Had to petition against this practice. 

Photo via @BenjaminRamm

https://mobile.twitter.com/i/moments/943141137761619968?t=1&cn=ZmxleGlibGVfcmVjcw%3D%3D&refsrc=email&iid=41c3015d379349e686e892f1d1521bd3&uid=2754606344&nid=244+273027072

attributes.action: Impose checks on companies reporting gender pay gap figures
attributes.background: The Financial Times recently reported that some companies who have submitted data on the gender pay gap within their organisations have produced â€˜highly improbableâ€™ figures. The government must set up a task force to investigate them and impose fines on companies who have filed inaccurate data.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/ad74ba76-d9cb-11e7-a039-c64b1c09b482

15 organisations so far have declared that they have no pay gap. The FT reported that it was 'highly anomalous' for those companies to report no gap. Since the FT scrutinised the figures of Hugo Boss, who initially reported zero pay gap, they have amended their submission to a mean gender pay gap of 32.6%. The law was introduced to prevent organisations from hiding their gender pay gaps. Letâ€™s not allow them to  report false data.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory dog licence In the UK
attributes.background: We all know in most cases itâ€™s not the dog but the owner at fault. If you are happy to take on the responsibility of the care of a pet dog then you should not be adverse to paying a fair licence fee and being held responsible for the dogs actions.
attributes.additional_details: Letâ€™s only permit responsible people to own dogs. How many times must we read stories of serious injuries or death, mistreated pets attacking adults, children or other dogs. Having adequate licence regulations in place would help weed out and ban future ownership of dogs belonging to people incapable of the task of raising a dog in a caring and responsible manner. If you are a caring dog lover then please support this petition to make life safer and kinder for both owners and dogs.

attributes.action: To authorise an amended version of the 1962 proposed Altrincham and Sale bypass.
attributes.background:
The A56 carries approx. 35,000 vehicles per day with HGVs and OGVs
contributing approx. 13.5% of this figure. Resulting air pollution affects peoples health, contributing to respiratory illness, heart disease and some cancers. Noise, road accidents, traffic congestion are other associated factors
attributes.additional_details:
Starting from the M60 Carrington Spur junction with Carrington Lane, going South across Carrington Moss towards Ashton Road joining the A56 west of the new A556 bypass, giving a direct link between the M60 jnc 8 to the M56 jnc 8 and onto the M6 jnc 19 via the new A556 intersections
Linking the M60 to the A56 west will create a new circular transportation network.
STOP THIS A56 TRAFFIC NIGHTMARE -BUILD THE ALTRINCHAM AND SALE BYPASS NOW.
Please sign the petition
Please sign this petition now.

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Let the people decide whether Brexit included the single market & customs union
attributes.background: This petition requires the UK Governemnt to clarify by public vote before March 2018 whether the intention of referendum voters was to leave membership of the EU only, or also to leave the single market and customs union and related institutions as extrapolated by the UK Government.

attributes.action: Clothing shops to have full disabled access and disabled changing facilities
attributes.background: Many stores in the UK donâ€™t have disabiled access and unsutiable changing facilities for people with disabilities. I would like the government to introduce legislation that would make it compulsory for all clothing stores to have disabled changing facilities.

attributes.action: reduce the brightness of vehicle emergency blue lights by half at night.
attributes.background: As a driver who works nights , I am regularly blinded by emergency vehicles using blue flashing lights. This causes a severe risk to other road users as my vehicle is a hgv that would cause mayhem if I lost control due to being blinded by these lights.

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Start teaching a language thoroughly from the school year of reception (age 4/5)
attributes.background: Teaching a language from primary school level is not yet compulsory at key stage 1, which is a major part of a childâ€™s development. If taught thoroughly from a younger age, the more likely a child is to remember the language, which will also help in their working future.
attributes.additional_details: A DfE representative found that there is no requirement to teach languages in all years in KS2, as long as the content of the programme of study has been covered by the end of KS2. The UK needs a multilingual population in order to succeed in a globalised world, for global citizenship, security and to operate efficiently in trade and investment. The research, commissioned by the British Council, also revealed that UK schoolchildren are now less likely to speak a foreign language than those in any other European nation.

attributes.action: Call on Boris Johnson to apologise immediately to Libya
attributes.background: Boris Johnson, the UKâ€™s foreign secretary, is yet again finding himself in troubled water after making arguably racist remarks about another country. The fact that a foreign secretary can do this is baffling. He must apologise immediately - his views are NOT echoed by the UK people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.com/news/amp/uk-politics-41490174

attributes.action: Nurses to work without having to pay an annual registration Â£120 fee to the NMC
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to support nurses not having to pay an annual registration fee to the NMC which is very costly . Nurses should be able to register without having to pay any fees .

attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Ban Plastic envelopes and Paper catalogues, where seller has e-mail details.
attributes.background: Having just received 5 "mail shots" in one postal delivery,from Internet retailers, they all went straight into recycling. Waste of plastic, paper, fuel and postage costs. All the Internet Retailers have my e-mail address and could just as easily have e-mailed their brochure saving all of the above.

attributes.action: Require all products sold in the UK containing plastic to have a warning label.
attributes.background: Plastic pollution is an ever growing global and local problem. It's important that consumers realise what they are buying, products/packaging containing plastic should bare a warning label to enable consumers to make better choices and to encourage producers to look for better alternatives.

attributes.action: Make Paper Carrier Bags & Packaging compulsory for shops and manufacturers
attributes.background: The Government introduced the 5p charge on carrier bags in shops they are now planning to implement it across all. BUT what they should be doing is stopping plastic being used- Paper Carrier Bags and packaging is far better for us and can be recycled easily this would be Enviromentally safer.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic carrier bags get into the water supply and sea causing harm to wild life and also in long run the food chain - Paper can be made to be biodegradable so if dumped would not cause harm to wild life and so would not harm us - let the UK ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ be a world leader in starting to bring back the classic Paper Carrier Bags for shops and then front leader in Paper or biodegradable card for packaging for manufacturers

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to choose the colour of their own passport.
attributes.background: This petition would permit each individual citizen to choose their own passport colour, which should be possible regardless of the eventual outcome of Brexit. Contrary to popular opinion, the EU does NOT mandate the passport colour of its member states.

attributes.action: Make local councils install CCTV outside schools to reduce the risk of accidents
attributes.background:
We all see lazy parents dropping their children off at school. 

This petition is to ask the government to make it compulsory for local councils to install cctv outside schools to catch and fine drivers who ignore road safety. In an attempt to persuade lazy drivers not to park on zig zag markings.

attributes.action: Stop the UK goverment from giving more than Â£20 billion to the EU.
attributes.background: Looking at net figures Britain has consistently paid billions of pounds to the EU usually only Germany contributing more. We have given so much over the years to help other EU members but with public services now struggling to meet the demands put on them it is time to put our own people first.

attributes.action: Require online retailers and platforms to disclose courier before order placed
attributes.background: When ordering goods online, websites generally do not state which courier service they will use for delivery. However, several courier companies have a track record of poor customer service and losing/damaging parcels. If consumers know which courier will be used, they can choose not to order.
attributes.additional_details: For an example, view the "tweets and replies" at @myhermes

attributes.action: Ban log burning stoves that pollute the air
attributes.background: Myself and my disabled husband cannot use our garden nor go out our door without smoke and smell on our clothes and air. Smoke and smell come into the house if we open a window or door.
attributes.additional_details: Have reported this to fire services, who saw it and gave us masks to wear to get to church. Carers have witnessed the debris and smoke. Environmental health officer saw it and debris and did nothing but said he should have collected the debris.

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Make all nightclubs and pubs charge the same price entry for men and women
attributes.background: With all the recent outrage about gender equality and the unfair treatment of women, I would like to highlight an issue which I feel should have been changed by now considering it is illegal to discriminate against someone because of gender: Nightclubs in the UK charge men more for entry.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair and there is no logical explanation behind it.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone Â£60+
